docs.title: ECManager
docs.text: A terminal UI to manage your AWS ElasticContainerService-Clusters

docs.title: Note
docs.text: This tool is currently under development and therefore not released yet.

docs.title: Technical Documentation
docs.text: This section contains technical documentation for the project.

docs.title: LocalDev
docs.text: We are using docker-compose to run our local development. On this subsection you can find handy information about how to run the local development.

docs.title: Moto
docs.text: Moto is a library that allows you to mock out AWS services for testing purposes. It is a great way to test our code without incurring the cost of running AWS services. We use Moto as standalone server to simulate AWS locally.

docs.title: Fixtures
docs.text: To modify the fixtures, we use a docker-compose sidecar, which add the fixtures to the moto container by using Boto3. The fixtures config can be found here.

docs.title: Why do we use Python as fixtures-loader?
docs.text:
We use python for our local fixtures for 2 reasons:

  • Boto3 is a greate SDK to interact with AWS
  • Moto is written in python, if we need examples we get them on their repo.
